title: How to Connect a Computer to a Stereo System

steps.title: This jack is usually green.
steps.content: This jack is usually green. You'll typically see it on the back of the computer. The out audio jack is usually coloured green.

steps.title: The plug should fit securely into the port.
steps.content: The plug should fit securely into the port.

steps.title: The other end of the cable goes into the female end of the stereo audio Y cable.
steps.content: The other end of the cable goes into the female end of the stereo audio Y cable.

steps.title: Plug in the white male RCA with the white female RCA.
steps.content: Plug in the white male RCA with the white female RCA. Then, plug the red male RCA with the red female RCA.

steps.title: The red port stands for right, and the white port stands for left.
steps.content: The red port stands for right, and the white port stands for left.

steps.title: Connect each plug to its corresponding color port.
steps.content: Connect each plug to its corresponding color port. Plug in the white male RCA with the white female port, and plug the red male RCA with the red female port.

steps.title: This tells the stereo to receive the sound from the computer.
steps.content: This tells the stereo to receive the sound from the computer. ===

steps.title: On some stereos this is either done by the remote control.
steps.content: On some stereos this is either done by the remote control. There might also be a switch on the face of the stereo.

steps.title: Check for connectivity on your computer.
steps.content: Check for connectivity on your computer. This may vary depending on what kind of computer/OS you have. If you're not hearing any sound, you may just need to change the audio output .
